intro: Rubus questieri microgene adjectus, commonly known as the microgene adjectus raspberry, is a rare species within the Rubus genus. It is characterized by its small, delicate bracts and trifoliate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically red when ripe. It thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil and partial shade. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a botanical curiosity and is often found in specialized horticultural collections.
